questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a hybrid Local Gateway?

discussion.content:
The purpose of a hybrid Local Gateway is to handle calls between the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) and Webex Calling. This allows organizations to use their existing PSTN connections while migrating to or integrating with Webex Calling.

Thus, the correct answer is:

B. to handle calls between the Public Switched Telephone Network and Webex Calling.

choices.B: to handle calls between the Public Switched Telephone Network and Webex Calling
choices.A: to handle calls between Cisco UCM and Webex Calling
choices.C: to handle calls between Webex Calling and Cisco Calling Plans
choices.D: to handle calls between Webex Calling and Cloud Connected PSTN

discussion.content:
The correct DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) value to mark video traffic between two Cisco 8845 phones is 34.

This corresponds to AF41 (Assured Forwarding 41), which is commonly used for video traffic in Cisco's QoS (Quality of Service) implementations.

So, the correct answer is:

C. 34

questions.question_text: Which DSCP value must be selected to mark video traffic between two Cisco 8845 phones?

choices.E: Active Directory with a forest functional level of 1 or higher
choices.B: TCP port 443 open from Directory Connector to the internet
choices.C: .NET Framework 3.4 installed on the Directory Connector server
choices.A: support for TLS 1.2 between Directory Connector and Webex Control Hub
choices.D: single sign-on between Directory Connector and Active Directory

questions.question_text: What are two requirements for deploying Directory Connector in Cisco Webex? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Note the following additional requirements:

Directory Connector requires TLS1.2. You must install the following:

.NET Framework v3.5 (required for the Directory Connector application. If you run into any issues, use the directions in Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using the Add Roles and Features Wizard.)

.NET Framework v.4.5 (required for TLS1.2)

Active Directory forest functional level 2 (Windows Server 2003) or higher is required.
Network Requirements
If your network is behind a firewall, ensure that your system has HTTPS (port 443) access to the internet.

Selected Answer: AB
A and B based on:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/directoryconnector/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins_chapter_01000.html#concept_29310515FEBCCE3C2EF4C36915988B96

questions.question_text: In a Dual Video Queue approach, what is the purpose of the CS4 class for Cisco video devices?

discussion.content:
D is correct. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/srnd/collab11/collab11/cac.html

Check Figure 13-24 Dual Video Queue Approach

choices.A: Desktop video traffic needs strict priority queuing marked with CS4 class
choices.C: Enforce a strict priority queueing for both desktop and immersive video traffic
choices.B: Create a simpler provisioning with one CBWFQ for desktop and immersive video traffic
choices.D: Immersive video traffic is marked with CS4 and placed in a CBWFQ separate from desktop video

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Workspaces. A workspace contains one or more Webex devices that are in a common area like a lunch room, lobby, or conference room. You can set up shared Webex devices in these workspaces, add services, and then watch the collaboration happen.

choices.C: to generate detailed reports about room usage
choices.D: to add services to shared devices in a common area
choices.B: to add or manage devices in an organization
